27/6/2023
------------
python introduction:
> print()
> variable
> comment
> datatype
    > int
    > float
    > string
    > list
    > tuple
    > set
    > frozenset
    > dictinary
    > bool
    > complex
> casting
> input()
> operators
> conditional programming(if, else , elif, nested if else, nested if elif else, ternary operator )
There are two type of loop
> Loop
    > For loop
        > single for loop
        > nested for loop
        > Pattern using single for loop
        > Pattern using nested for loop
        > range()
        > iterable
        > break
        > continue
        > pass
        > comprehension
            > list comprehension
            > set comprehension
            > forzenset comprehension
            > tuple comprehension
            > dictionary comprehension
                              
    > while loop
        > sigle while loop
        > nested while loop
        > pattern using single while loop
        > pattern using nested while loop
        > break 
        > continue
        > pass
        > while loop does not support comprehension

> function 
    > def 
        > default argument
        > position argument
        > keyword argument
        > arbitrary positional argument
        > arbitrary keyword argument
    > return 
    > lambda(anonymous function, fat function )
    > nested function
    > decorator
    > generator(yield)
> Package and module
    > import 
    > from keyword to import package and module
    > alising using "as"

> multitasking(threading,Process)
> garbage collector (gc)

> OOPs(object oriented programming)
    > Programming paradigm:
        > top line programming
        > procedural programming/function programming
        > object oriented programming(oop)
    > class(Blueprint)
        > constructor(def __init__())
        > class variable
        > instance variable
        > static methods
        > class methods
    > object(variable/identifier/argument)
    > Encapsulation
    > polymorphism
        > overloading(python doesnot support)
        > overridding 
    > inheritance
    > abstraction 
        >> class function 
            >> class variable 
            >> static function

> Database(CRUD--> Create , Read , Update, delete)
    > SQL(Mysql)
    > NoSQL(MongoDB)
